<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" media="screen" href="/~d/styles/rss2full.xsl"?><?xml-stylesheet type="text/css" media="screen" href="http://feeds.howtogeek.com/~d/styles/itemcontent.css"?><rss xmlns:content="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/content/" xmlns:wfw="http://wellformedweb.org/CommentAPI/" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:media="http://search.yahoo.com/mrss/" xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" xmlns:sy="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/syndication/" xmlns:slash="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/slash/" version="2.0">

				<atom10:link xmlns:atom10="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" rel="self" type="application/rss+xml" href="http://feeds.howtogeek.com/HowToGeek" /><feedburner:info xmlns:feedburner="http://rssnamespace.org/feedburner/ext/1.0" uri="howtogeek" /><atom10:link xmlns:atom10="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" rel="hub" href="http://pubsubhubbub.appspot.com/" /><image><link>http://www.howtogeek.com/</link><url>http://www.howtogeek.com/geekers/up/sshot4ebc09559ecbf.jpg</url><title>How-To Geek</title></image><item>
			<title>Is There a Difference Between Name Server and Domain Name Search Results?</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/254114/is-there-a-difference-between-name-server-and-domain-name-search-results/</link>
						<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 20:04:25 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Akemi Iwaya</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?p=254114</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://www.howtogeek.com/thumbcache/580/230/556ed6fe3cbe77ef47b6b0eb04c0eb30/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/is-there-difference-between-name-server-domain-name-search-results-00.jpg" /></p><p>When looking up information about a website, there are different amounts of data you can find based on the type of search you do. You may also find yourself wondering if the same type of search goes by more than one name as well. With that in mind, today&#8217;s SuperUser Q&amp;A post has the answers to a confused reader&#8217;s question.</p><p><h3><a href='http://www.howtogeek.com/254114/is-there-a-difference-between-name-server-and-domain-name-search-results/'>Click Here to Continue Reading</a></h3></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/-hCRRSNY228" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>
				<item>
			<title>How to Tune Your Guitar with the Amazon Echo</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/253811/how-to-tune-your-guitar-with-the-amazon-echo/</link>
						<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 19:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Craig Lloyd</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?p=253811</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://www.howtogeek.com/thumbcache/580/230/e34d860d71908394ccac5f792d58f83f/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/IMG_2395-copy-650x300.jpg" /></p><p>While the Amazon Echo is known for providing news and traffic info, or playing music and reading your audiobooks to you, that&#8217;s really just the tip of the iceberg. Using an add-on Skill, you can use the voice-controlled device to help you tune your guitar without any extra tools.</p><p><h3><a href='http://www.howtogeek.com/253811/how-to-tune-your-guitar-with-the-amazon-echo/'>Click Here to Continue Reading</a></h3></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/v1GXgZ0WD0E" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>
				<item>
			<title>Geek Trivia: The Majority Of History’s Massive Volcanic Eruptions Have Occured Where?</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/trivia/the-majority-of-historys-massive-volcanic-eruptions-have-occured-where/</link>
						<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 17:37:12 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Jason Fitzpatrick</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?post_type=trivia&p=254604</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://cdn8.howtogeek.com/wp-content/uploads/gg/up/sshot542ef4d2a58a8.png" /></p><table width="650px" border="0"><tr><td><h3><a href="http://www.howtogeek.com/trivia/the-majority-of-historys-massive-volcanic-eruptions-have-occured-where/">The Majority Of History&#8217;s Massive Volcanic Eruptions Have Occured Where?</a></h3></td></tr><tr><td colspan="2" align="left" valign="top"><ol><li> Iceland</li><li> Africa</li><li> The Pacific Ocean</li><li> Australia</li></ol><p>Think you know the answer?</p></td></tr></table><em><p><a href="http://www.howtogeek.com/trivia/the-majority-of-historys-massive-volcanic-eruptions-have-occured-where/"><img src="http://cdn8.howtogeek.com/geekers/up/readmore-button.png" border="0" /></a></p></em><p></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/-OogkVo9X1k" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>
				<item>
			<title>How to “Hide” Contacts on the iPhone for Greater Privacy</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/254239/how-to-hide-contacts-on-the-iphone-for-greater-privacy/</link>
						<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 16:34:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Matt Klein</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?p=254239</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://www.howtogeek.com/thumbcache/580/230/65d459ac34b54aaedef7e462651273ac/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/img_573262c35394d-1-650x300.jpg" /></p><p>Do you have contacts on your iPhone that you want to keep private? Or, maybe you have a bunch of contacts that you want to keep, but don&#8217;t want appearing in your address book. iOS actually has a built-in way to do just that.</p><p><h3><a href='http://www.howtogeek.com/254239/how-to-hide-contacts-on-the-iphone-for-greater-privacy/'>Click Here to Continue Reading</a></h3></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/QFDoEc-cGJA" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>
				<item>
			<title>How to Disable the Delete Confirmation Dialog Box in Outlook</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/254677/how-to-disable-the-delete-confirmation-dialog-box-in-outlook/</link>
						<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:24:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Lori Kaufman</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?p=254677</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://www.howtogeek.com/thumbcache/580/230/c4b259a6ee66019e1642f1434d64cbe1/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/00_lead_image_delete_confirmation_dialog.png" /></p><p>If you delete a lot of emails when sifting through your Outlook inbox, you might have turned on the option to automatically empty the deleted items folder when exiting Outlook. That’s handy, but you most likely have to confirm the deletion of the emails every time.</p><p><h3><a href='http://www.howtogeek.com/254677/how-to-disable-the-delete-confirmation-dialog-box-in-outlook/'>Click Here to Continue Reading</a></h3></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/7MkWuD0N01A" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>
				<item>
			<title>How to Teach Siri Who People Are (for Faster Calling)</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/254454/how-to-teach-siri-who-people-are-for-faster-calling/</link>
						<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 13:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Walter Glenn</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?p=254454</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://www.howtogeek.com/thumbcache/580/230/948e4832b9d44e28458440bf3263354f/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/siripeople_top-650x300.png" /></p><p>Calling people with Siri is a great little shortcut, but it isn&#8217;t always natural to say &#8220;Call Jane Smith&#8221; instead of &#8220;Call Mom&#8221;. Luckily, you can teach Siri who people are&#8211;your parents, your doctor, or anyone else&#8211;for even more convenient voice calling.</p><p><h3><a href='http://www.howtogeek.com/254454/how-to-teach-siri-who-people-are-for-faster-calling/'>Click Here to Continue Reading</a></h3></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/cLGTRjt-_5U" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>
				<item>
			<title>How to Take Screenshots and Record Videos on an Xbox One</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/254580/how-to-take-screenshots-and-record-videos-on-an-xbox-one/</link>
						<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 12:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Chris Hoffman</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?p=254580</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://www.howtogeek.com/thumbcache/580/230/e993d55d448b603321b7a203878e48c5/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/img_57338eab61031.jpg" /></p><p>Microsoft&#8217;s Xbox One allows you to easily capture a screenshot or record the last thirty seconds of gameplay as a video. You can also use the Game DVR app for more fine-grained recording options. All video clips are saved in 720p resolution at 30 frames per second.</p><p><h3><a href='http://www.howtogeek.com/254580/how-to-take-screenshots-and-record-videos-on-an-xbox-one/'>Click Here to Continue Reading</a></h3></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/31bqSBZ7R_M" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>
				<item>
			<title>The Five Most Useful Features in Nova Launcher for Android</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/254182/the-five-best-features-of-nova-launcher/</link>
						<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 10:40:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Cameron Summerson</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?p=254182</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://www.howtogeek.com/thumbcache/580/230/4077e7feaad5d128076a096551e6466e/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/IMG_8369-650x300.jpg" /></p><p>Nova Launcher is an unofficial fan favorite for Android power users, and with good reason—it’s chock-full of nifty customization features to help users make Android look how they want. But it’s also full of useful time-saving features that can make your life easier. Here are five of our favorites.</p><p><h3><a href='http://www.howtogeek.com/254182/the-five-best-features-of-nova-launcher/'>Click Here to Continue Reading</a></h3></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/7H5nN1olo1w" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>
				<item>
			<title>How to Update Your Plex Media Library, Manually and Automatically</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/254357/how-to-update-your-plex-media-library-manually-and-automatically/</link>
						<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 20:04:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Jason Fitzpatrick</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?p=254357</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://www.howtogeek.com/thumbcache/580/230/d6d2db387e77ea42e1e65bd4b8b7148a/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/img_57320721ed5dc.jpg" /></p><p>Besides the media itself, the most important element of a media server software is how up to date it is&#8211;you can&#8217;t watch videos if the server doesn&#8217;t know they&#8217;re there. Plex Media Server offers three ways to keep your media collection up to date so you always know what&#8217;s available.</p><p><h3><a href='http://www.howtogeek.com/254357/how-to-update-your-plex-media-library-manually-and-automatically/'>Click Here to Continue Reading</a></h3></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/fUjqCvQlym8" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>
				<item>
			<title>How to Set a Timer for Your Belkin WeMo Switch</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/251453/how-to-set-a-timer-for-your-belkin-wemo-switch/</link>
						<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 19:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Craig Lloyd</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?p=251453</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://www.howtogeek.com/thumbcache/580/230/a8e1b162f407b94b3eb6c9bcf371c133/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/belkin-650x300.jpg" /></p><p>The WeMo Switch is a cheap and easy-to-use smart outlet that can turn anything with an on/off switch into a smart appliance, allowing you to control it from your smartphone. Plus, it comes with a small handful of automation features, including the ability to set a timer so that it shuts off automatically after a certain amount of time has elapsed.</p><p><h3><a href='http://www.howtogeek.com/251453/how-to-set-a-timer-for-your-belkin-wemo-switch/'>Click Here to Continue Reading</a></h3></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/sbRW9ODDVPA" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>
				<item>
			<title>Geek Trivia: What Common First Aid Technique Wasn’t Invented Until The 1960s?</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/trivia/what-common-first-aid-technique-wasnt-invented-until-the-1960s/</link>
						<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 17:37:15 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Jason Fitzpatrick</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?post_type=trivia&p=254444</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://cdn8.howtogeek.com/wp-content/uploads/gg/up/sshot542ef4d2a58a8.png" /></p><table width="650px" border="0"><tr><td><h3><a href="http://www.howtogeek.com/trivia/what-common-first-aid-technique-wasnt-invented-until-the-1960s/">What Common First Aid Technique Wasn&#8217;t Invented Until The 1960s?</a></h3></td></tr><tr><td colspan="2" align="left" valign="top"><ol><li> Recovery Position</li><li> The Heimlich Maneuver</li><li> Tourniqueting </li><li> CPR</li></ol><p>Think you know the answer?</p></td></tr></table><em><p><a href="http://www.howtogeek.com/trivia/what-common-first-aid-technique-wasnt-invented-until-the-1960s/"><img src="http://cdn8.howtogeek.com/geekers/up/readmore-button.png" border="0" /></a></p></em><p></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/1yVPITtry8M" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>
				<item>
			<title>How to Use Sonos as an Alarm or Sleep Timer</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/254174/how-to-use-sonos-as-an-alarm-or-sleep-timer/</link>
						<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 16:34:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Matt Klein</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?p=254174</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://www.howtogeek.com/thumbcache/580/230/86db530a61fada3475411b246d2fab0e/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/img_5731f20f59044.png" /></p><p>Sonos is great because you can set up and control speakers from any room in your dwelling. If you like to wake up to or fall asleep to music, then they&#8217;re especially well suited to have in your bedroom.</p><p><h3><a href='http://www.howtogeek.com/254174/how-to-use-sonos-as-an-alarm-or-sleep-timer/'>Click Here to Continue Reading</a></h3></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/7tdmLUevq24" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>
				<item>
			<title>How to Schedule or Delay Sending Email Messages in Outlook</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/254282/how-to-schedule-or-delay-sending-email-messages-in-outlook/</link>
						<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 14:24:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Lori Kaufman</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?p=254282</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://www.howtogeek.com/thumbcache/580/230/3406161a3a97483fc746b407027a8cba/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/00_lead_image_do_not_deliver_before.png" /></p><p>When you click Send on an email, it is typically sent immediately. But what if you want to send it at a later time? Outlook allows you delay the sending of a single message or all email messages.</p><p><h3><a href='http://www.howtogeek.com/254282/how-to-schedule-or-delay-sending-email-messages-in-outlook/'>Click Here to Continue Reading</a></h3></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/fM4JwOpLKuE" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>
				<item>
			<title>Insert Emoji Faster with iOS’ Text Replacement Shortcuts</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/254424/insert-emoji-faster-with-ios-text-replacement-shortcuts/</link>
						<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 13:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Walter Glenn</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?p=254424</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://www.howtogeek.com/thumbcache/580/230/bbc507c8bcad6f2c6a4797eb34c93aed/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/emoji_top-650x300.png" /></p><p>Emoji are fun to use, but if you&#8217;re like most people, you tend to use a few of them a lot more often than others. Instead of switching to the Emoji keyboard every time, why not set up a text replacement shortcut so that you can just type the Emoji you want to use?</p><p><h3><a href='http://www.howtogeek.com/254424/insert-emoji-faster-with-ios-text-replacement-shortcuts/'>Click Here to Continue Reading</a></h3></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/ZG4W31sNbw0" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>
				<item>
			<title>How to Factory Reset Your Xbox One</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/254253/how-to-factory-reset-your-xbox-one/</link>
						<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 12:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Chris Hoffman</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?p=254253</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://www.howtogeek.com/thumbcache/580/230/bc3ded3950c3c61b28de8850580d3736/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/img_573124565c2e1.png" /></p><p>Before you sell your Xbox One or pass it on to someone else, you should perform a factory reset. This wipes all your personal data. Whoever gets the Xbox One will have to go through the first-time setup process once again, signing in with their own Microsoft account.</p><p><h3><a href='http://www.howtogeek.com/254253/how-to-factory-reset-your-xbox-one/'>Click Here to Continue Reading</a></h3></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/lARJBeHebHk" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>
				<item>
			<title>The Freeware Download Sites That Don’t Force Crapware On You</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/254042/the-freeware-download-sites-that-dont-force-crapware-on-you/</link>
						<pubDate>Wed, 11 May 2016 10:40:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Chris Hoffman</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?p=254042</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://www.howtogeek.com/thumbcache/580/230/1ede2c36ff72031fc989c66e39fa0d45/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/freewaresites-650x300.jpg" /></p><p>It&#8217;s been more than a year since we drew attention to the crapware regularly foisted upon unsuspecting users by pretty much every big freeware site, including the venerable SourceForge. Since then, a few sites&#8211;including SourceForge themselves&#8211;have started cleaning up their act.</p><p><h3><a href='http://www.howtogeek.com/254042/the-freeware-download-sites-that-dont-force-crapware-on-you/'>Click Here to Continue Reading</a></h3></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/bB-wm5W-xOM" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>
				<item>
			<title>How Do Web Servers Know if You Are Using Direct IP Address Access or Not?</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/254097/how-do-web-servers-know-if-you-are-using-direct-ip-address-access-or-not/</link>
						<pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 20:04:06 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Akemi Iwaya</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?p=254097</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://www.howtogeek.com/thumbcache/580/230/624513d13e939238115ef063b8551726/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/how-do-web-servers-know-if-you-are-using-direct-ip-address-access-or-not-00.jpg" /></p><p>Usually, we just type in the address of a website we want to view, but would a web server actually &#8220;know&#8221; if we used the direct IP address instead? Today&#8217;s SuperUser Q&amp;A post has the answer to a confused reader&#8217;s question.</p><p><h3><a href='http://www.howtogeek.com/254097/how-do-web-servers-know-if-you-are-using-direct-ip-address-access-or-not/'>Click Here to Continue Reading</a></h3></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/3Lo3IEoLBII" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>
				<item>
			<title>How to Automatically Turn Off Your Nest Thermostat When It’s Cool Outside</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/252386/how-to-automatically-turn-off-your-nest-thermostat-when-it%e2%80%99s-cool-outside/</link>
						<pubDate>Tue, 10 May 2016 19:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
			<dc:creator>Craig Lloyd</dc:creator>
			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?p=252386</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://www.howtogeek.com/thumbcache/580/230/b77e4b972add1b3da4e4ddfb9fb3cc5c/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/IMG_2358_stomped-650x301.jpg" /></p><p>Warm weather is on its way, which means that air conditioning units are firing up. However, there are some days when the temperature actually drops to a pleasant level. Here&#8217;s how to make your Nest Thermostat automatically shut off whenever the outside temperature gets cooler.</p><p><h3><a href='http://www.howtogeek.com/252386/how-to-automatically-turn-off-your-nest-thermostat-when-it%e2%80%99s-cool-outside/'>Click Here to Continue Reading</a></h3></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/OMJOTKoqTUc" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
									</item>

			<title>How to Create iPhone Reminders for When You Get In and Out of Your Car</title>
			<link>http://www.howtogeek.com/253855/how-to-create-iphone-reminders-for-when-you-get-in-and-out-of-your-car/</link>

			<guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.howtogeek.com/?p=253855</guid>
						<description><p><img src="http://www.howtogeek.com/thumbcache/580/230/e88ad418cb989554429cc81fa742ca35/wp-content/uploads/2016/05/img_572fe3a648ef4.png" /></p><p>We all have those times when we have to remember something before we leave the house or return, but always seem to forget. With iOS, though, you set reminders that trigger whenever you get in or out of your car.</p><p><h3><a href='http://www.howtogeek.com/253855/how-to-create-iphone-reminders-for-when-you-get-in-and-out-of-your-car/'>Click Here to Continue Reading</a></h3></p><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/HowToGeek/~4/4dKybbL5nco" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description>
